intro: Monanthotaxis buchananii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is typically dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in African herbal medicine.
